attributes.action: Abolish the new Independent Safeguarding Authority and Vetting and Barring Scheme
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Due to the Government’s vetting and barring scheme, which is due to be introduced October 2009, it is estimated that 1 in 4 adults will be required to register with the Home Office's Independent Safeguarding Authority (ISA). This will range from parents who regularly drive children for sports or social clubs to those whose children are in a foreign exchange scheme.

Complaints or concerns from colleagues or members of the public that fall short of prosecutions may be held on an individual’s file by the ISA and will be available for viewing by any employer or voluntary group with which the person might work

This scheme is a disproportionate response that risks deterring volunteers.
